content: towel topper supplies needed yarn - worsted weight hook size g 5/8 button hand towel towel preparation if necessary zigzag 2 lines down the middle of the towel cut between the two lines to provide a finished edge for two towels or divide towel in half cut and serg stitch explanation double_crochet decrease yo insert hook in next st yo draw lp through yo draw through 2 lps on hook 2 times yo draw through all 3 lps on hook notes make the beginning & ending single_crochet s of row 1 as close to the edges as possible i use a chain 2 for a turning chain rather than the traditional chain 3 it almost always works better for me and i ve written my patterns accordingly feel free to sub back the chain 3 you may or may not be able to use the g hook on row 1 depending on the weave of your towel with a loose weave you ll probably be able to jab it through but with a tight weave you may need something to aid in poking a starter hole i used a steel crochet hook size 1 crochet instructions row 1 right side single_crochet at least 46 sts evenly across towel more is fine -- just decrease down to 46 while working row #2 less is fine too -- just rewrite the rest of the pattern to your needs row 2 chain 2 counts as double_crochet throughout pattern double_crochet in each st if there were more than 46 single_crochet s after row 1 then decrease evenly by working double_crochet decrease s - see stitch explanation above 46 double_crochet s row 3 chain 2 double_crochet decrease across double_crochet in turning chain 24 double_crochet s row 4 chain 2 double_crochet decrease across double_crochet in turning chain 13 double_crochet s row 5 chain 2 double_crochet decrease twice double_crochet in next 3 sts double_crochet decrease twice double_crochet in turning chain 9 double_crochet s row 6 - 14 chain 2 double_crochet in each st row 15 chain 1 does not count as a stitch now or in next row single_crochet in next st half_double_crochet double_crochet skip 1 double_crochet forms the buttonhole double_crochet half_double_crochet single_crochet slip_stitch in turning chain row 16 ch1 slip_stitch in next st single_crochet in next 4 sts slip_stitch in last st fasten_off weave ends and sew button to middle of row 5 © 2011 joyce noverr ladynthread for personal or nonprofit use only
